choices.C: To secure data transmission between cloud and on-premises environments
choices.D: To transform data from structured to unstructured
choices.B: To ingest and analyze structured and unstructured data at scale, in real time
choices.A: To natively visualize both types of data using a dashboard in real time

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
B is correct.
This one threw me. I wouldn't associate "unstructured data" with a data warehouse. The phrasing of this one is very confusing. I'm not sold on B being the answer.

Selected Answer: B
Data warehouses assemble data from multiple sources including databases. An enterprise data warehouse is a system used for the analysis and reporting of structured and semi-structured data from multiple sources.

Selected Answer: B
A could have been a valid answer, but one can do a lot more than just visualize.

Selected Answer: B
B. Real-time data ingestion and updates. A simple and universal solution for continually ingesting your enterprise data into popular cloud-based data warehouses in real time.

https://www.qlik.com/us/cloud-data-migration/cloud-data-warehouse
B seems OK
B. To ingest and analyze structured and unstructured data at scale, in real time

questions.question_text:
An organization recently launched a virtual customer support agent, generating vast amounts of text and speech data.
Why should they use a cloud data warehouse to interpret this data?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Keywords: Functions, serverless Computing

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
To add a new function to their application, the organization can use the serverless computing platform offered by their public cloud provider. For example, they could use AWS Lambda, Google Cloud Functions, or Azure Functions.
The organization should use serverless computing as the infrastructure solution to add the new function to their application.

comments.content: "to write the code and let the public cloud provider handle the infrastructure" I think this is the definition of serverless technology.
VM is a IaaS, this itself will put A as a wrong choice as infrastructure is to be handled by cloud, not user- hence no IaaS

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
My choice is A; Because "wants to add a new function to their application". Using VM is more appropriate
For Serverless Computing - the organization needs to fully migrate the application - not just add a new function alone
C : Serverless Computing. They have to write a function. So use Cloud Functions which is Serverless computing.
C. Serverless computing

questions.question_text:
An organization wants to add a new function to their application. They want to write the code and let the public cloud provider handle the infrastructure.
Which infrastructure solution should they use?
